title: Torque Unit Converter – N·m, ft·lb, in·lb, N·cm, kgf·m

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Basic definition \(\tau = F \cdot r\) where \(\tau\) is torque, \(F\) is the applied force and \(r\) is the lever arm (moment arm) measured perpendicular to the force.

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: \(\tau_{\text{N·m}} = \tau_u \cdot k_u\) Example: for ft·lb, \(k_{\text{ft·lb}} = 1.3558179483\), so 50 ft·lb → 50 × 1.3558179483 ≈ 67.79 N·m.
